metadata.description: Marketplace for Context Engineering skills library

plugins.name: context-fundamentals
plugins.description: Understand the components, mechanics, and constraints of context in agent systems. Use when designing agent architectures, debugging context-related failures, or optimizing context usage.

plugins.name: context-optimization
plugins.description: Apply optimization techniques to extend effective context capacity. Use when context limits constrain agent performance, when optimizing for cost or latency, or when implementing long-running agent systems.

plugins.name: context-compression
plugins.description: Design and evaluate context compression strategies for long-running agent sessions. Use when agents exhaust memory, need to summarize conversation history, or when optimizing tokens-per-task rather than tokens-per-request.

plugins.name: context-degradation
plugins.description: Recognize, diagnose, and mitigate patterns of context degradation in agent systems. Use when context grows large, agent performance degrades unexpectedly, or debugging agent failures.

plugins.name: multi-agent-patterns
plugins.description: Design multi-agent architectures for complex tasks. Use when single-agent context limits are exceeded, when tasks decompose naturally into subtasks, or when specializing agents improves quality.

plugins.name: memory-systems
plugins.description: Design and implement memory architectures for agent systems. Use when building agents that need to persist state across sessions, maintain entity consistency, or reason over structured knowledge.

plugins.name: evaluation
plugins.description: Build evaluation frameworks for agent systems. Use when testing agent performance, validating context engineering choices, or measuring improvements over time.

plugins.name: advanced-evaluation
plugins.description: Master LLM-as-a-Judge evaluation techniques including direct scoring, pairwise comparison, rubric generation, and bias mitigation. Use when building evaluation systems, comparing model outputs, or establishing quality standards for AI-generated content.

plugins.name: project-development
plugins.description: Design and build LLM-powered projects from ideation through deployment. Use when starting new agent projects, choosing between LLM and traditional approaches, or structuring batch processing pipelines.

plugins.name: tool-design
plugins.description: Design tools that agents can use effectively, including when to reduce tool complexity. Use when creating, optimizing, or reducing agent tool sets.

plugins.name: book-sft-pipeline
plugins.description: Standalone skill for training models to write in any author's style. Complete pipeline from ePub to trained adapter with Gertrude Stein case study.
